alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Carson; Gray; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall; Roberts (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 3:56PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...Scattered thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Armstrong, northeastern Randall, Carson, Hutchinson, western Gray, eastern Potter, Roberts and eastern Moore Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 353 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms, moving southwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Amarillo, Pampa, Borger, Panhandle, Claude, Fritch, Sunray, Stinnett, White Deer, Groom, Lefors, Skellytown, Sanford, Lake Mcclellan, Washburn, Pringle, Kingsmill, Codman, Lake Meredith and Mescalero Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. These type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Armstrong; Carson; Gray; Hutchinson; Moore; Potter; Randall; Roberts
